sectionInfo.text:
During our last survey many people showed interest in the topic of Mental health. That is why we decided to evaluate our well-being within the MAGIC collaboration. We are using the PHQ-8 (Kroenke et al. 2010*) questionnaire to evaluate the levels of depressive symptoms. (more information on the bottom if you are interested)

PHQ-8 is largely used to measure current depressive symptoms in the clinical and epidemiological studies and in health surveys. The score on PHQ-8 cannot be corresponded as a diagnosis of a major depressive disorders, it mainly serves a statistical evaluation of the situation in a certain population. Since the symptoms are not just connected to depression, it usually correlated with other mental well-being indicators and can give an impression of the overall picture. Studies were it was used:

Germany 2018 General German population: S. Bundesamt. Kinderlosigkeit,Geburten und Familien: Ergebnisse des Mikrozensus 2018. https://www.destatis.de/DE/Themen/Gesellschaft-Umwelt/Bevoelkerung/Geburten/_inhalt.html,2019. Mental health of PhDs in non-university organizations in Germany 2019: https://www.universitaetsverlagwebler.de/_files/ugd/7bac3c_6974dfc41c054e3b94ff8590718fe819.pdf US 2006: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18752852/ 2013-2015 in EU countries: https://www.thelancet.com/pdfs/journals/lanpub/PIIS2468-2667(21)00047-5.pdf Spain during pandemic (2020): https://annals-general-psychiatry.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12991-022-00385-3 Students during pandemic (2020, different countries): https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-021-97697-3.pdf?origin=ppub

*Kroenke, K., Spitzer, R. L., Williams, J. B., and Löwe, B. (2010): The patient health questionnaire somatic, anxiety, and depressive symptom scales: a systematic review. In: General hospital psychiatry, 32 (4), P. 345-359. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.genhosppsych.2010.03.006.
